intro: Angylocalyx boutiqueanus, commonly known as the boutiquean angylocalyx, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form with glossy, oval-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and typically display shades of white and pink. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is highly sought after by botanists and horticulturists.
